title: I-ADOPT Variable (Decomposed Form)
description: A single scientific variable structured according to the I-ADOPT framework. This compact JSON model is used for LLM benchmarking and represents: label, natural-language definition, cleaned comment, property, objects/entities, matrices, context objects, and constraints.

comment.description: Use a short summary of the definition. Do not add new concepts.

hasProperty.description: The main measurable property in the definition.

hasObjectOfInterest.description: The thing that has the property.

hasMatrix.description: Medium in which the object occurs. Not a process or location.

hasContextObject.description: Optional contextual Entity or System that provides environmental or situational context (e.g., 'air', 'atmosphere').

hasConstraint.description: List of Constraints describing states, conditions, purity, normalization, or other limiting qualifiers and or quantifiers that apply to the Entity.

label.description: Short cleaned phrase describing the restriction (e.g., 'dry', 'purity 99.98%', '5.00 g sample', 'per mol').

on.description: What the constraint applies to (The name of a Property or Entity in this variable, e.g. 'distance', 'mass flux', 'habitat patch', 'organism').

entityOrSystem.description: An Entity or System involved in the variable. It may be a simple entity (e.g., 'hexanol', 'air', 'soil') or a structured system (asymmetric or symmetric).

oneOf.$comment: Asymmetric system, from A to B
Symmetric system, A and B together form a system
